articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as Pakistan play Netherlands in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: Pakistan bat first against Netherlands - clips, radio & text

articles.description: Reaction to European wins for Liverpool, Aston Villa and West Ham, while Brighton and Aberdeen draw but Rangers lose, plus Premier League build-up.
articles.title: European reaction - wins for Liverpool & West Ham, Rangers lose

articles.description: West Ham won their second Europa League match after resisting a second-half fightback to beat Freiburg.
articles.title: West Ham win at Freiburg as Aguerd sinks hosts

articles.description: Watch ex-England cricketer Stuart Broad try his hand at baseball, with the help of MLB great Chase Utley, before the MLB Saturday Showdown live on the BBC.
articles.title: 'I've got no confidence' - Can Broad play baseball?

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on KSI and Tommy Fury in this weekend's Premier League game predictions.
articles.title: Sutton's Premier League predictions v KSI & Tommy Fury

articles.description: England's thrashing at the hands of New Zealand is a worry, but there are reasons not to lose hope on their World Cup defence just yet.
articles.title: 'England's defeat is a worry but don't panic yet'

articles.description: Coco Gauff extends her winning streak to 16 matches as the American sets up a semi-final against Iga Swiatek at the China Open.
articles.title: Gauff sets up meeting with Swiatek in Beijing

articles.description: As Arsenal prepare to host Manchester City on Sunday, we assess whether they are in a better position to win the Premier League title this season.
articles.title: ‘They could easily win the league’- are Arsenal closer to Man City?

articles.description: Pakistan batter Babar Azam is dismissed for five by Netherlands' Colin Ackermann in the 2023 Cricket World Cup in Hyderabad.
articles.title: Ackermann claims 'huge' wicket of Babar

articles.description: Ben Earl waited three and a half years for an England start, but has forced his way to become first choice by focusing on what he does best.
articles.title: 'Kind of unstoppable' - Earl's long road to Test favour
